results.title: Super Bowl LX: Seahawks-Patriots picks, key stats, predictions - ESPN
results.snippet: The Patriots were fourth at 2.8 percentage points, buoyed by a league-best explosive creation rate of 13.6% on offense. And the Seahawks' explosive-play differential of 4.7 percentage points was the best mark in the NFL and the ninth-best figure ...

results.title: Super Bowl LX Cheat Sheet: The 22 Things to Know About Patriots vs. Seahawks - The Ringer
results.snippet: It’s just hard to be good on offense when you’re dealing with so many negative plays. When Maye has time, he can be extremely dangerous. One of the keys to his MVP-caliber season has been a willingness to make high-degree-of-difficulty throws. Overall, 17.3 percent of Maye’s attempts have been into tight windows—that’s the fourth-highest rate among starting quarterbacks. The Seahawks defense will challenge him.

results.title: Advanced stats preview for Super Bowl 60 Patriots vs. Seahawks | Pats Pulpit
results.snippet: It will be up to Maye and Kayshon Boutte to reverse that in Super Bowl LX. ... The past Patriots and past Seahawks set for Feb. 8 at Levi’s Stadium. ... Players to watch, stats, injuries, and more for the Patriots’ opponent in the Super Bowl. ... Notes and thoughts on the Road Warriors identity, slowing down the Seahawks, and more heading into Super Bowl week.﻿ ... The Patriots will be going up against the best pass offense yet in the NFL playoffs.

results.title: 2025 New England Patriots season - Wikipedia
results.snippet: On Baltimore’s next drive, Ravens wide receiver Zay Flowers fumbled, and the Patriots ran out the clock to secure the win. With the win, the Patriots improved to 12–3, finishing 3–1 against the AFC North, and clinched their first playoff berth since 2021.

decision.reasoning: Limited direct matchup data. Key stats: Seahawks have NFL-best explosive-play differential (+4.7%), superior to Patriots' offense (4th, +2.8% explosive creation). Seahawks total first downs (339) > opponents (291), indicating offensive edge; passing first downs strong (176 team vs. 206 opp, but total favors SEA). Patriots playoff wins gritty/low-scoring (16-3, 28-16, 10-7), suggesting defensive strength but vulnerability vs. elite offenses. Seahawks defense challenges high-risk QBs like Maye (17.3% tight-window throws, 4th-highest). Market at 53.8% YES implies ~54% SEA win prob; my estimate ~55% based on explosive edge/differentials, but no clear statistical mispricing (>5% edge needed for conservative bet). Pats momentum from playoffs noted, but numbers don't show strong counter. No injuries/matchup history decisive. Capital preservation prioritizes wait for edge.
